page.title: 11ST.JOHN THE BAPTIST CHURCH.
page.content: Sharon and Dawn went to see the Rev. Hicks and he told them about the church of St. John the Baptist in Buckhorn Weston. He also preaches at two other churches in the area. The present church building was built about 130years ago.Prior to this building there had been a place of Christian worship on this site since the legend began of Joseph of Arimathea arriving in Glastonbury with the crown of thorns.The foundations of this early church still exist and now incorporated in the structure of the present church. Services are held in this church every Sunday and on saints' days but there are no evening services. It has a choir and an organist and they practice on Friday nights. There is a regular congregation of 25-30 people.
